Class Soviet

  • java.lang.Object
    • Soviet
  • public class Soviet
extends java.lang.Object
    Sovietbot is a chatbot who is a very bad Soviet spy in the early 1990s, who hasn’t realized that the Soviet Union split up yet. Based off the Magpie Activity in CSA
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Gene Pan, Rupali Sarathy

      java.lang.String transformCanYou​(java.lang.String statement)
      Transforms the user statement “Can you (something)?” and makes it “I refuse to listen to your orders.
      java.lang.String transformDidYou​(java.lang.String statement)
      Parses for the user statement “Did you hear about (something)?” and responds with “What about it? Give me information capitalist pig.”
      java.lang.String transformIWant​(java.lang.String statement)
      Take a statement with "I want ." and transform it into "Would you really be happy if you had ?"
      java.lang.String transformIWantTo​(java.lang.String statement)
      Take a statement with "I want to ." and transform it into "What would it mean to ?"
      java.lang.String transformKnowAbout​(java.lang.String statement)
      Transforms the user statement “Do you know about (something)?” and makes it “(Something)? Seems like American propaganda to me.
      java.lang.String transformWhyWant​(java.lang.String statement)
      Parses for the user statement “Why do you want (something)?” and responds with “I just want information… to… spread capitalism.”
      java.lang.String transformYouAre​(java.lang.String statement)
      Transforms the user statement “You are (something).” and makes it “Me? (something)? You shall not define me.” Capitalizes the something.
      java.lang.String transformYouMeStatement​(java.lang.String statement)
      Take a statement with "you me" and transform it into "What makes you think that I you?" Also works if statement is "you me " and transforms it into "What makes you think that I you ?"
      java.lang.String transformYouThink​(java.lang.String statement)
      Transforms the user statement “What do you think about (something)?” and makes it “Me? (something)? You shall not define me.”

      • transformYouMeStatement

        public java.lang.String transformYouMeStatement​(java.lang.String statement)
        Take a statement with "you me" and transform it into "What makes you think that I you?" Also works if statement is "you me " and transforms it into "What makes you think that I you ?"
        Parameters:
        statement - the user statement, assumed to contain "you" followed by "me"
        Returns:
        the transformed statement

      • transformYouThink

        public java.lang.String transformYouThink​(java.lang.String statement)
        Transforms the user statement “What do you think about (something)?” and makes it “Me? (something)? You shall not define me.”

      • transformDidYou

        public java.lang.String transformDidYou​(java.lang.String statement)
        Parses for the user statement “Did you hear about (something)?” and responds with “What about it? Give me information capitalist pig.”

      • transformCanYou

        public java.lang.String transformCanYou​(java.lang.String statement)
        Transforms the user statement “Can you (something)?” and makes it “I refuse to listen to your orders. I will not (something).”

      • transformKnowAbout

        public java.lang.String transformKnowAbout​(java.lang.String statement)
        Transforms the user statement “Do you know about (something)?” and makes it “(Something)? Seems like American propaganda to me. shall not define me.” Capitalizes the Something.

      • transformYouAre

        public java.lang.String transformYouAre​(java.lang.String statement)
        Transforms the user statement “You are (something).” and makes it “Me? (something)? You shall not define me.” Capitalizes the something.

      • transformWhyWant

        public java.lang.String transformWhyWant​(java.lang.String statement)
        Parses for the user statement “Why do you want (something)?” and responds with “I just want information… to… spread capitalism.”

        Pick a default response to use if nothing else fits.
        Returns:

      • findKeyword

        public int findKeyword​(java.lang.String statement,
                       java.lang.String goal,
                       int startPos)
        Search for one word in phrase. The search is not case sensitive. This method will check that the given goal is not a substring of a longer string (so, for example, "I know" does not contain "no").
        Parameters:
        statement - the string to search
        goal - the string to search for
        startPos - the character of the string to begin the search at
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of goal in statement or -1 if it's not found

      • findKeyword

        public int findKeyword​(java.lang.String statement,
                       java.lang.String goal)
        Search for one word in phrase. The search is not case sensitive. This method will check that the given goal is not a substring of a longer string (so, for example, "I know" does not contain "no"). The search begins at the beginning of the string.
        Parameters:
        statement - the string to search
        goal - the string to search for
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of goal in statement or -1 if it's not found
